intro: Polyactium gibbosum, commonly known as the globe lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, globe-shaped inflorescence. The plant produces showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its bulbs are adapted for storage and can remain dormant for extended periods. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
